body:
December 2020, most browsers are going to stop support for Flash.

So anyway, tell me about all those flash games that you all played on sites like armorgames, maxgames, miniclip, etc, when you were all young.

I'll start with some of mine

Raze 2 - Side scrolling platforming shooter about aliens and zombies attacking humans and an impending apocalypse. The game needed skill to play, had a lot of things like achievements and the OST was also one of the best ones I could remember for flash games. A similar game that I knew about was called Armor Mayhem. 

Robot wants <item> - There were 4 games on this. Robot wants Kitty, Robot Wants Puppy, Robot wants Fishy, and Robot wants Icecream. Sidescrolling metroidvania style game.

Siegius - Sidelined Strategy based game, about the wars fought between Caesar and gaul commander Vercing.

Rebuild/Rebuild 2 - Turn based strategy game set in post apocalyptic world taken over by zombies.

Age of War - Classic tower defense+offense style game about progressing through stages of human history to defeat your AI opponent.

And also several games from StickPage, like Stick War and Interactive Buddy.

body:
I used to love nitrome.com when I was a kid. They had games like bad ice cream, swindler, parasite and final ninja.
Those were good times. I feel sad to see those sites die off now.

post.body:
December 2020, most browsers are going to stop support for Flash.

So anyway, tell me about all those flash games that you all played on sites like armorgames, maxgames, miniclip, etc, when you were all young.

I'll start with some of mine

Raze 2 - Side scrolling platforming shooter about aliens and zombies attacking humans and an impending apocalypse. The game needed skill to play, had a lot of things like achievements and the OST was also one of the best ones I could remember for flash games. A similar game that I knew about was called Armor Mayhem. 

Robot wants <item> - There were 4 games on this. Robot wants Kitty, Robot Wants Puppy, Robot wants Fishy, and Robot wants Icecream. Sidescrolling metroidvania style game.

Siegius - Sidelined Strategy based game, about the wars fought between Caesar and gaul commander Vercing.

Rebuild/Rebuild 2 - Turn based strategy game set in post apocalyptic world taken over by zombies.

Age of War - Classic tower defense+offense style game about progressing through stages of human history to defeat your AI opponent.

And also several games from StickPage, like Stick War and Interactive Buddy.

body: Mud and Blood 2, the only flash game I still occasionally play. It's a World War II real-time strategy game, where you control a small squad on randomized map against waves of enemies. Objective: Survive as long as you can. It is a slow game in the beginning, and learning all the units (both friend and foe), weapons, structures, terrain, orders, support and game mechanics takes time. But once you get a hang of it, there is a huge amount of depth for a flash game. I recommend trying it out if you have time, rounds can sometimes last close to an hour. You will probably be overrun before that though, so don't worry too much about the time. There is a wiki to help you out, with an overview to get you started. More detailed info if you are interested here. The game is playable on the official site, Kongregate, or by downloading BlueMaxima's Flashpoint. War is not fair.
body_html:
Mud and Blood 2, the only flash game I still occasionally play. It's a World War II real-time strategy game, where you control a small squad on randomized map against waves of enemies. Objective: Survive as long as you can.

It is a slow game in the beginning, and learning all the units (both friend and foe), weapons, structures, terrain, orders, support and game mechanics takes time. But once you get a hang of it, there is a huge amount of depth for a flash game. I recommend trying it out if you have time, rounds can sometimes last close to an hour. You will probably be overrun before that though, so don't worry too much about the time.

There is a wiki to help you out, with an overview to get you started. More detailed info if you are interested here.

The game is playable on the official site, Kongregate, or by downloading BlueMaxima's Flashpoint.

War is not fair.

post.body:
December 2020, most browsers are going to stop support for Flash.

So anyway, tell me about all those flash games that you all played on sites like armorgames, maxgames, miniclip, etc, when you were all young.

I'll start with some of mine

Raze 2 - Side scrolling platforming shooter about aliens and zombies attacking humans and an impending apocalypse. The game needed skill to play, had a lot of things like achievements and the OST was also one of the best ones I could remember for flash games. A similar game that I knew about was called Armor Mayhem. 

Robot wants <item> - There were 4 games on this. Robot wants Kitty, Robot Wants Puppy, Robot wants Fishy, and Robot wants Icecream. Sidescrolling metroidvania style game.

Siegius - Sidelined Strategy based game, about the wars fought between Caesar and gaul commander Vercing.

Rebuild/Rebuild 2 - Turn based strategy game set in post apocalyptic world taken over by zombies.

Age of War - Classic tower defense+offense style game about progressing through stages of human history to defeat your AI opponent.

And also several games from StickPage, like Stick War and Interactive Buddy.

body:
Madalin Stunt Cars 2 is a cool car game I played alot in school. You crash into things, do tricks and go really really fast. Played it especially on this site: https://sites.google.com/site/unblockedgame76/Madalin-Stunt-Cars-2-unblocked

Super Smash Flash 2 (ssf2) is my favourite smash bros fan game. The addition of characters like Tails and Waddle Dee made me happy. Has better online than SSBU (change my mind.) https://www.mcleodgaming.com/games/ssf2

Fireblob/Fireblob WInter  - Some fun and cute 2d platformers where you control a blob of fire and reach the end of the level. I beat the first game, but not the second one. https://www.kongregate.com/games/noadev/fireblob

Jailbreak 2 - A game where you sneak around, try to avoid the cop's line of sight, and escape prison. I like it 'cause it was really hard for me. https://sites.google.com/site/unblockedgamesforpeasants/home/jailbreak-2

body:
Where to start... first things first, my own flash archive (https://ipxforever.com/swf) is a good place to look to see what I like.

That said, I like Ray and Ray 2, which are choose your own adventure games. (rather gory ones)

I like all of the Henry Stickmin games

I like the entire Epic Battle Fantasy series

And I like the Papa Louie games as well as some 2dplay games
